mn149:1.1: This discourse is “great” because it integrates multiple distinct teaching frameworks within the six sense fields. These include the majority of the _saṁyutta-mātikā_, the list of topics making up the Saṁyutta Nikāya.
mn149:3.2: In other words, one who becomes attached to sense experience creates kamma that generates a new life. This passage integrates the teachings on the six sense fields and the five aggregates under the first noble truth, as well as briefly implying the basic principle of dependent origination.
